question.text: Two soap bubbles $A$ and $B$ are kept in a closed chamber where the air is maintained at pressure $8 \mathrm{Nm}^{-2}$. The radii of bubbles $A$ and $B$ are $2 \mathrm{~cm}$, respectively. Surface tension of the soap-water used to make bubbles is $0.04$ $\mathrm{Nm}^{-1}$. Find the ratio $\frac{n_B}{n_A}$, where $n_A$ and $n_B$ are the number of moles of air in bubbles $A$ and $B$, respectively. [Neglect the effect of gravity]
